title: Foreign Language Training Program to be launched in capital’s schools
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 23 (APP):The Ministry of Federal Education and Professional Training  has planned to launch a foreign language training program in the schools of Islamabad to enhance students’ employability in the global market.
According to an official source, the program will be launched in collaboration with National University of Modern Languages (NUML) and National Vocational and Technical Commission (NAVTTC).
The program will offer courses in Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Arabic, and German languages for the students from Grades 9-12.
This initiative is aimed at equipping the students with valuable language skills, foster cultural understanding, and prepare them for the 21st-century global economy challenges.
The program will provide students with proficiency in foreign languages, enhancing their career prospects and promoting cultural exchange.
